channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Covid: Shop worker's worry after being spat at
item.description: Tracey's depression flared up after suffering abuse as a union wants more protection for retail staff.

item.title: Love Island: Liam Reardon's hometown celebrates win
item.description: Bricklayer Liam Reardon has had a cocktail named after him and he's been offered a free pasty.

item.title: Alex Jones: One Show host has baby daughter
item.description: The BBC presenter already has two sons and now she has given birth to her first daughter.

item.title: Wrexham: Three arrests after man's death following 'disturbance'
item.description: Detectives are investigating as a man in his 50s died after an incident in a north Wales village.

item.title: Church in Wales to vote on same-sex blessings
item.description: The church's governing body will consider the bill at its conference in Newport in September.

item.title: Gareth Bale and Aaron Ramsey reunited in Wales squad for September World Cup qualifiers
item.description: Wales name star duo Gareth Bale and Aaron Ramsey in their squad for September's World Cup qualifiers.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Laura Sugar eyes Tokyo gold after canoe switch
item.description: Laura Sugar believes switching from para-athletics to para-canoeing has boosted her Tokyo Paralympics medal bid.

item.title: Long Covid: Patients to help devise Betsi Cadwaladr's treatment plans
item.description: A woman left needing crutches to walk says long Covid has destroyed her active life.

item.title: Rhondda Cynon Taf council reviews trans guidance after row over pupil
item.description: Teachers started calling a pupil by a new name without speaking to the parents, their lawyer says.

item.title: Brecon woman 'dependent' on drugs prescribed to treat her
item.description: Niki Jones has spent the past 18 years taking various drugs to treat her chronic pain.

item.title: Snowdon: Call to respect mountain amid spike in visitors
item.description: Litter, erosion and traffic put "significant pressure" on the mountain, says Snowdonia Society.

item.title: Defibrillators: Welsh rugby calls after player's death
item.description: Alex Evans, 31, died on Saturday after having a cardiac arrest during a match in Neath Port Talbot.

item.title: Rugby boy completes 150-mile walk to visit grandparents
item.description: Arthur Mortimer, 15, takes on the fundraising feat having not seen his nan and grandad for 18 months.

item.title: Covid-19 now 22nd leading cause of death in Wales
item.description: For six of the last 16 months of the pandemic, Covid-19 was the leading cause of death in Wales.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Baroness Grey-Thompson tips Welsh duo for gold
item.description: Baroness Tanni Grey-Thompson tips Aled Sion Davies and Hollie Arnold as Wales' best hopes for gold at the Tokyo Paralympics.

item.title: Porthcawl RNLI surfer rescue in storm captured on camera
item.description: The footage of the rescue shows an 18-year-old US surfer pulled clear of a rip current.

item.title: Chronic pain: Brecon woman on the 'spiral' of chasing pain relief
item.description: Niki Jones had two horses and a successful career before she developed chronic pain.

item.title: Calls for more pitchside defibrillators following rugby player's death
item.description: Alex Evans, 31, died on Saturday after having a cardiac arrest during a rugby match.

item.title: Snowdon: 'This is the worst queuing I can remember'
item.description: A group maintaining the mountain warns of the pressures large numbers of visitors bring.

item.title: Paralympics: Calls for wheelchair motocross to be in Games
item.description: There are calls for the adaptive skateboarding sport to be in the Paralympics by 2028.

item.title: Gareth Bale: Captain to lead Wales for September World Cup qualifiers
item.description: Captain Gareth Bale remains committed to Wales as he aims to lead them to their first World Cup since 1958, says manager Robert Page.

item.title: Dragons sign Cardiff scrum-half Lewis Jones on loan deal
item.description: Dragons sign scrum-half Lewis Jones on a short-term loan deal from Cardiff Rugby for the start of the 2021-22 season.

item.title: From 'worst team ever' to Euros semis, Wales' 10-year journey from lowest ebb
item.description: Ten years on from their worst ever Fifa world ranking, Wales players, staff and fans assess how the country became a force.

item.title: Wales call up Liverpool's Owen Beck for Uefa U21 Euro 2023 qualifier in Bulgaria
item.description: Liverpool teenager Owen Beck has been recalled by Wales for their Uefa U21 Euro 2023 qualifier against Bulgaria in Sofia on Tuesday, 7 September.

item.title: Kyle Anderson: Darts world pays tribute to Australian who has died aged 33
item.description: Darts players and PDC pay tribute to Australian Kyle Anderson after his death aged 33.

item.title: Cleifion Covid hir i deilwra triniaeth i eraill
item.description: Y bwriad ydy cynnig cymorth gan ystod o feddygon arbenigol mewn un lle - o ffisiotherapyddion i seicolegwyr.

item.title: Gall enillydd Dinas Diwylliant 'brofi hwb i'r economi leol'
item.description: Gallai'r ardal sy'n dod i'r brig yn y gystadleuaeth "brofi hwb fawr i'r economi leol", yn ôl arbenigwr.

item.title: Cymru'n enwi carfan gref ar gyfer gemau mis Medi
item.description: Gareth Bale ac Aaron Ramsey ymysg y 27 sydd wedi'u dewis ar gyfer y gemau yn erbyn Y Ffindir, Belarws ac Estonia.

item.title: Y Cymro sefydlodd un o gwmnïau wisgi mwyaf America
item.description: Pwy oedd y gŵr o Gymru aeth i America a sefydlu wisgi byd enwog?

item.title: O 'dîm gwaethaf Cymru erioed' i ddau Ewros mewn 10 mlynedd
item.description: Yn Awst 2011 fe ddisgynnodd y crysau cochion i 117fed yn rhestr detholion y byd, eu safle isaf erioed.
